text: Uzbekistan competed in the Winter Olympic Games as an independent nation for the first time at the 1994 Winter Olympics in Lillehammer, Norway. Previously, Uzbek athletes competed for the Unified Team at the 1992 Winter Olympics. ==Medalists== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !Medal !Name !Sport !Event |- | || Lina Cheryazova || Freestyle skiing || Women's Aerials |} ==Figure skating== ;Ice Dancing {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !colspan="9"|Final |- !Compulsory Dance 1 !Rank !Compulsory Dance 2 !Rank !Original Dance !Rank !Free Dance !Total !Rank |- |Aliki Sergaadu Yuris Razgulyayev |align="center"|2.4 !align="center"|12 |align="center"|2.4 !align="center"|12 |align="center"|7.2 !align="center"|12 |align="center"|13.0 |align="center"|25.0 !align="center"|13 |- |Dinara Nurdbayeva Muslim Sattarov |align="center"|4.2 !align="center"|21 |align="center"|4.2 !align="center"|21 |align="center"|12.6 !align="center"|21 |align="center"|21.0 |align="center"|42.0 !align="center"|21 |} ==Freestyle skiing== ;Men {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Qualifying !colspan="2"|Final |- !Points !Rank !Points !Rank |- |Sergey Brener |Aerials |align="center"|159.93 |align="center"|19 |align="center" colspan=2|Did Not Advance |} ;Women {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Qualifying !colspan="2"|Final |- !Points !Rank !Points !Rank |- |Lina Cheryazova |Aerials |align="center"|144.43 |align="center"|12 Q |align="center"|166.84 !align="center"| |- |Larisa Udodova |Moguls |align="center"|20.28 |align="center"|21 |align="center" colspan=2|Did Not Advance |} ==References== *Official Olympic Reports *International Olympic Committee results database *sports-reference Category:Nations at the 1994 Winter Olympics 1994 Winter Olympics
